Description: Fragment of shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase with root of triple-reeded handle; yellowish slip; glazed black either side and face of handle; lotus bud below at base of central reed; black blob with added red at right; below, glazed area with added red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA156.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.425)
